titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Joseph Babb, Indictment
CWG6379

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
McCracken Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Jasper Babb, A L. Banks, Wm Wallace, E. C. Lusk Jas Newberry & W R Babb --

The Grand Jury of McCracken County in the name name by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse W R Babb A. L. Banks Wm Wallace, E. C. Lusk, Jas Newberry & Jasper Babb of the crime of Horse stealing -- comitted as follows, Viz the said Babb, Banks Wallace Lusk, Newberry & Babb did on the 14th day of April 1865 in the county aforesaid feloniously take and carry away, one horse of the value of one hundred dollars, the personal property of S Sherin.

The Grand jury aforesaid charge, that at the time & place aforesaid the said James Newberry & Jasper Babb feloniously took & carried away one horse of the value of one hundred dollars the personal property of S Sheron and the said, W R Babb, A. L. Banks Wm Wallace & E. C. Lusk were accessories before the fact by aiding advising encouraging & persuading the said theft

The Grand Jury aforesaid charge that at the time & place aforesaid the said Wm Wallace & E C Lusk feloniously took & carried away one horse of the value of one hundred dollars the personal property of S Sheron -- and the said W R Babb A L Banks, Jas Newberry Jasper Babb were accessories before the fact in aiding advising & encouraging the said theft -- all against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky --

Witnesses
S Sheron, Jacob Roark
Franklin Harris
Wm Holt
Ed Moore of Graves Co

A Copy -- attest
B Small Clk
By Henry. C. Yeiser D C"
"Bail is fixed on this indictment at Five hundred Dollars for each defendant
"W R Babb has been dishcarged by order of Court"

B Small C. M. C. C.
By Henry C Yeiser D. C"

"Coml"
v } Horse Stealing
Jasper Babb & others

A true bill
J. G. Cole
foreman
